item.title: Misconceptions About Overpopulation and Global Food
item.description:
[caption id="attachment_1335" align="alignright" width="300" caption="Flying Singer on Flickr"][/caption]

I realize this article could use some citations. If enough people show interest, I'll take the time to put them in. Otherwise, I recommend the works of Dr. Vandana Shiva, and any of the recent food politic books (Michael Pollan, eg.)

The latest issue of Popular Science included an article about the benefits of genetically modified food, citing the somewhat unlikely marriage of a plant geneticist and an organic farmer who have combined their work to develop crops that are more resistant to disease and produce higher yields. The newsworthy aspect of all this is that GMOs in this case are both organic and seemingly beneficial to all. After all, as the world's population continues to grow, we're going to need more food, and we're running out of land. Or so says the article.
